publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8035 Jackie Baillie: Citizens of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates June Galloway and Grace McDermid on being named citizens of the year for Dumbarton and the Vale respectively; notes that June Galloway was nominated for her extensive volunteering activities including 27 years volunteering with the talking newspaper for the blind, Rockvale Rebound, tutoring school pupils every week after school and organising social events with the Riverside Church in Dumbarton; understands that Grace McDermid has been honoured for her voluntary work at the Vale of Leven Hospital over the last 40 years; further understands that Grace has established a tea bar that has raised over £140,000 for the hospital and is also involved as a Christian Aid organiser for her local church, St Kessog’s, in Balloch, and congratulates both women on what it considers their well deserved recognition for their hard work and dedication to their respective communities.
S3M-8035 Citizens of the Year (lodged on 1 March 2011) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-8035 Citizens of the Year (lodged on 1 March 2011) Hugh Henry*, Trish Godman*, Mary Mulligan*, Gil Paterson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Ross Finnie*

S3M-8035 Jackie Baillie: Citizens of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates June Galloway and Grace McDermid on being named citizens of the year for Dumbarton and the Vale respectively; notes that June Galloway was nominated for her extensive volunteering activities including 27 years volunteering with the talking newspaper for the blind, Rockvale Rebound, tutoring school pupils every week after school and organising social events with the Riverside Church in Dumbarton; understands that Grace McDermid has been honoured for her voluntary work at the Vale of Leven Hospital over the last 40 years; further understands that Grace has established a tea bar that has raised over £140,000 for the hospital and is also involved as a Christian Aid organiser for her local church, St Kessog’s, in Balloch, and congratulates both women on what it considers their well deserved recognition for their hard work and dedication to their respective communities. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Hugh Henry, Trish Godman, Mary Mulligan, Gil Paterson, Mr Frank McAveety, Ross Finnie

S3M-8035 Jackie Baillie: Citizens of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates June Galloway and Grace McDermid on being named citizens of the year for Dumbarton and the Vale respectively; notes that June Galloway was nominated for her extensive volunteering activities including 27 years volunteering with the talking newspaper for the blind, Rockvale Rebound, tutoring school pupils every week after school and organising social events with the Riverside Church in Dumbarton; understands that Grace McDermid has been honoured for her voluntary work at the Vale of Leven Hospital over the last 40 years; further understands that Grace has established a tea bar that has raised over £140,000 for the hospital and is also involved as a Christian Aid organiser for her local church, St Kessog’s, in Balloch, and congratulates both women on what it considers their well deserved recognition for their hard work and dedication to their respective communities. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Hugh Henry, Trish Godman, Mary Mulligan, Gil Paterson, Mr Frank McAveety, Ross Finnie
